captions.text:
Hello, and welcome to
"Weird Gross & Beautiful"

a casual discussion about
animals that I think

are weird, gross,
beautiful or all three.

And today we're
talking about ducks.
So cute, for the most part.
[THEME MUSIC]

Ducks come in all
different kinds
of color, not just yellow.

In fact, only the ducklings
are typically yellow,

but they can come in all
variety of colors like green,

and purples, and greys, and
white, and brown, and bronze.

And there's just so
many different colors
that a duck could be.

Baby ducks are called
ducklings and the momma ducks

are called hens and the daddy
ducks are called drakes.

A group of ducks can be
called a few different things,
my favorite being a paddling.

Look at that paddling
of ducks, oh my god.

Ducks are silly, weird
little clumsy walkers.
They do the little wobble thing.

And they're beautiful swimmers
and they are fantastic flyers.

And some ducks can fly at
speeds up to 50 miles per hour.
That's fast.

Unlike geese, which our
awful and fly in V's, ducks

do not fly in a formation of
any kind, they just sort of
fly together.
Did you know that I hate geese?

A gotta a whole
episode about it.

Some ducks will fly all the way
from Canada to Central America.
That's so far.

But on the way they will stop
at the same feeding sites
every year.

Like they have a little
route that they go on.

It's like a little family road
trip that they take every year.

When making her
nest, the momma duck

will take feathers
from her breast

and line her nest with it, so
that her little baby birdie

eggs will have the perfect
amount of installation
and softness.
And, oh, that's so cute.

That's so sweet,
Mommy, thank you.
Ducks have three eyelids.

They have the top one,
and then the bottom one.

And then they have one
that's on the side that

will act like
goggles so that they

can swim under the water with
their eyes open but not open
because they have the goggles.
Ducks are really weird.

I mean, I think that baby
ducks are super cute.

But I learned stuff, I learned
stuff that I can never unlearn.

All right, so these next
couple of facts about them

are neither weird,
gross, or beautiful,

they're just a
little disturbing.

Ducks exhibit
cannibalistic behavior.

And while we're not really
sure why they do it,

it is correlated with
boredom and is aggravated

by lack of ventilation
or overcrowding
and faulty nutrition.
Yeah, I'm bored.

I'm gonna go eat
this other person.

Only 3% of birds as a
whole has male genitalia
that we call a penis.

But ducks are one
of them that has it

and they have a special,
super duper scary penis,
it's a corkscrew.
Oh, no.

From mid-March onwards,
a small group of drakes

will congregate, like
maybe a dozen or so,

and chase down a single female
and attempt to rape her.
They will also rape dead ducks.
Yep, necrophilia.

That's where we're
going in this journey.
Now this is sort of interesting.

Males, they have like
the corkscrew penis,
it goes counterclockwise.

In an attempt to stop
herself from being raped,

she has developed a
vagina that corkscrews
the other way, so clockwise.

So, it can't, it
can't get in there.
So then no rape is happening.

But then how does
she get pregnant?
How does it happen?

Ahhh, nature is a
beautiful mystery.

Thank you so much for watching
"Weird Gross & Beautiful."

This is all I got for
you, I'm really sorry.

If you'd like to you can follow
me on twitter @catiewayne

and suggest an animal for
me to cover next time.

Today's episode was
suggested by TehEpicDuck.
[BLEEP] you.

I'm just kidding,
I love you a lot.

But Jesus why are you
so infatuated with them?

But before you go I
would like to announce

that we're having our very
first ever "Weird Gross

Beautiful" t-shirt
design contest.
Yea!

So all you got to do is submit
a drawing or a design of my face

or animals or both and submit
it to @animalists on the twitter
machine.
Also subscribe.
Do that.

I'm looking forward to seeing
all of your lovely designs.
And I love you.
And I'll see you next time.
Bye.
Mwah.
